intro: Phyllanthus fangchengensis, commonly known as Fangchengensis spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Guangdong province, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features include a short stem, alternate leaves, and cyathium inflorescences, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species with potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
